The Mossberg 590A1 is a hammerless pump-action shotgun designed by Carl Benson.
 Modified due to Navy requests, this improved model has an aluminum trigger guard and safety, a heavier barrel, and a bayonet lug.
 Intended for use under extreme conditions, this weapon became the standard shotgun in the United States military.
 This specific model includes a Picatinny rail for mounting accessories.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]ATTACHMENTS:
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] ACOG, Aimpoint T1, Barska ES AC10632, C-More, Docter III, ELCAN SpecterDr, EOTech, EOTech XPS3-0

The Mossberg 590A1 is a hammerless pump-action shotgun designed by Carl Benson.
 Modified due to Navy requests, this improved model has an aluminum trigger guard and safety, a heavier barrel, and a bayonet lug.
 Intended for use under extreme conditions, this weapon became the standard shotgun in the United States military.
 Retrograde models feature a walnut stock with checkered grip, vented recoil pad and matching forend.
